data.title: Curious about Regent University's Graduation Rate
data.meta_description:
Sure, I can provide you with that information! According to the National Center for Education Statistics, Regent University has a 59% graduation rate. This rate accounts for full-time, first-time undergraduates who completed their program within 150% of the normal time. So for a standard four-year program, this graduation rate would look at how many students graduated within six years. 

However, do keep in mind that many factors can influence graduation rates, such as the type and rigor of the academe, individual student's rigor, and financial circumstances. Always consider the whole picture when deciding on a university, not just exclusively the graduation rate.

One last tip: you can check the NCES's College Navigator whenever you want to find statistics like this for any American university or college. It's a pretty handy resource!
data.text:
Hey everyone, I hope y'all are doing well! So, I've been considering Regent University for next year and I wanted to ask something. I've been trying to find out more about the graduation rate at Regent University. Do any of you guys have any insight or sources where I could check this info? Thanks in advance!

a month ago

Sure, I can provide you with that information! According to the National Center for Education Statistics, Regent University has a 59% graduation rate. This rate accounts for full-time, first-time undergraduates who completed their program within 150% of the normal time. So for a standard four-year program, this graduation rate would look at how many students graduated within six years.

However, do keep in mind that many factors can influence graduation rates, such as the type and rigor of the academe, individual student's rigor, and financial circumstances. Always consider the whole picture when deciding on a university, not just exclusively the graduation rate.

One last tip: you can check the NCES's College Navigator whenever you want to find statistics like this for any American university or college. It's a pretty handy resource!

a month ago
